title: Contra Costa County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week; max $100,000 annual sales. Two-year pilot approved June 20, 2024; permits began July 1, 2024. Fees (effective 6/24/2025): Initial permit $847; annual renewal $565. Certain foods prohibited (e.g., raw oysters, raw milk; no HACCP items).

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand limits.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Contra Costa County
- ☐ Menu and daily/weekly production plan
- ☐ Basic kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Visit Contra Costa Health's Home Kitchens page for program overview and FAQs.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes planning

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume and that it fits MEHKO limits (30/day, 90/week).

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your Certified Food Protection Manager (CFPM) credential; helpers get Food Handler cards.

**Why it matters:** Operator must hold a food safety manager certificate; all food workers need Food Handler cards.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Food Handler cards for helpers
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK and city business license if required

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; use county page for training links and workshop signups.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days total (study + exam)

**Ready when:** You have a CFPM certificate PDF and any property/business approvals.

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Gather the documents you'll submit with your application.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete submissions delay approval and inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP form — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ CFPM certificate (from Step 2: Approvals & Training)
- ☐ Government ID and basic business info

**Where/how:** Organize files (PDFs/photos) for email submission or drop-off.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** All documents are filled/signed and stored as PDFs.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the MEHKO SOP covering menu, prep, storage, service, and sanitation.

**Why it matters:** This shows the county how you will keep food safe at home.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Prep/cooking/cooling/holding details (same-day service required)
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; handwashing setup

**Where/how:** Complete the SOP form in this step.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and consistent with your operation (note prohibited items like raw oysters, raw milk; no HACCP items).

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the county Health Permit Application for a Microenterprise Home Kitchen Operation.

**Why it matters:** This is the official request to operate a MEHKO.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner/site information and contact details
- ☐ CFPM certificate details
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Where/how:** Complete the application in this step. Submit by email or in person per instructions.

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** Application is complete and matches your SOP (note: permits expire end of February each year).

Contra Costa Environmental Health MEHKO application

steps.title: Submit Application & Pay Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit the completed forms and pay required fees.

**Why it matters:** The county processes your permit after complete submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ CFPM certificate
- ☐ Payment method

**Where/how:** Email your packet to Contra Costa Environmental Health or submit in person at 2120 Diamond Blvd, Suite 100, Concord. Visit the Environmental Health fee page for amounts and payment options.

**Cost & time:** Initial permit $847; annual renewal $565 · 10–20 minutes to submit

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment.

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Coordinate a home kitchen inspection with Environmental Health.

**Why it matters:** Passing inspection is required before operating.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen set up per your SOP (same-day prep/cook/serve)
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ Required equipment functional

**Where/how:** The department will provide scheduling details after application review.

**Cost & time:** Included in permit fee · 1–2 hours on site

**Ready when:** You receive a pass and any corrections are resolved.

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your MEHKO permit after passing inspection and keep it posted.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Final approval notice
- ☐ Permit document (expires end of February)

**Where/how:** Issued by Environmental Health after inspection approval.

**Cost & time:** $0 (after application fee) · a few days after approval

**Ready when:** You have the permit and any conditions noted by the inspector.

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP and MEHKO limits; renew annually.

**Why it matters:** Staying within rules protects customers and your permit.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Meal logs under 30/day and 90/week; sales ≤ $100,000/yr
- ☐ Temperature & cleaning records
- ☐ Renewal reminder before end of February

**Where/how:** Keep simple records; update SOP if menu/operations change.

**Cost & time:** Renewal $565 (current) · ongoing

**Ready when:** You track meals/sales, keep records, and schedule renewal on time.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information below for questions and assistance.

**Why it matters:** County staff can help with specific questions about your application.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone or email for questions
- ☐ Office hours and location
- ☐ Website for more resources

**Where/how:** Contra Costa Environmental Health, 2120 Diamond Blvd, Suite 100, Concord, CA 94520. Phone: (925) 608-5500. Email: cocoeh@cchealth.org. Office hours: Mon–Fri 7:30am–4:30pm (lunch 12–1); field/plan review available 7:30–9am.

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies by question

**Ready when:** You have the information you need to proceed.
